text: from across the globe this is Stan
Bannerman bringing you the most popular
science tech and current affairs news
direct from Twitter Mindwarp this week
we'll find out how you'll soon be
traveling at hypersonic speeds what
facebook envy is and who is the new king
of twitter but first up a small gray
monkey has reportedly taken a trip into
space yes this week Iran has announced
that they launched a primate inside a
cavish go rocket reaching an altitude of
120 kilometers for a sub-orbital flight
in something of a cold war s development
to their blossoming space program one
small step for a monkey tomorrow's
forecast partly cloudy with a hundred
percent chance of monkey guts on your
car step closer to having a monkey
butler service on the moon indeed
cryptically the Iranians have said that
the shipment returned to Earth intact
whatever that may mean and that this ape
has joined the ever-expanding list of
organisms that they have sent into space
which now includes a rat a turtle and
worms they plan to add a human to that
illustrious roll call in the next five
years next up how about traveling from
Europe to America in an hour this could
be a reality if a fleet of space liners
get off the ground Martin siple of the
German Aerospace Center says that by
2050 this new vehicle would take
approximately eight minutes to climb to
an altitude of 50 miles reaching the
Earth's upper atmosphere before gliding
down to its destination on earth at
speeds of more than 15,000 miles per
hour hope they have space on board for
my hover chair after you this might just
be a one-way ticket to deep space london
sydney in 90 minutes yes please it's
certainly impressive although screeching
through the skies at 24 times the speed
of sound doesn't quite seem like the
most relaxing start to a summer
break back on earth the findings of a
new study has uncovered that 20 minutes
on Facebook can seriously affect your
mental state the research carried out by
darmstadt technical university and the
Humboldt University in Berlin has found
out that many facebook users are left
with feelings of envy loneliness and
misery after reading about their friends
love lives vacations and work successes
on the site feeling dissatisfied with
your life not to worry it's probably
just a case of Facebook Envy I saw this
mentioned the other day and began to
grieve for Humanity it seems holiday
photos are the biggest cause of Facebook
envy closely followed by how many likes
or comments other users are receiving on
posts the research found that women are
more likely to feel envious of physical
attractiveness while people in their
mid-30s are more likely to envy family
happiness in short researchers have
discovered that concerted Facebook use
mixes feel like our friends are happier
wealthier more popular and just
downright prettier than us finally this
week that shrinking violet lady gaga has
handed over her Twitter crown to justin
bieber and his vast army of believers
she tweeted I'm so proud of Justin
Bieber and all the believers I'm only
happy to see your fans growing in size
you are deserve it while others felt
there is no hope for Humanity we finally
have conclusive proof that the internet
was a mistake yes in 2013 the most
popular member of Twitter with a
jaw-dropping 33 million three hundred
and thirty three thousand followers is
not one of the world's leading
scientists or politicians but a teenager
in a pair of questionable trousers
consider yourself mind-warped until next
time keep tweeting bountiful
this has been at Stan badgermin hashtag
mine what is head squeeze it's a crack
or maybe crackpot team of scientists
mathematicians social commentators news
journalists comedians looking at what's
going on in the world in a slightly
left-field sort of way and dissecting
all the stuff that's being discussed on

a purple wherever else news and
information is disseminated
